entries.name: BLACK
entries.desc: Set the terminal's foreground ANSI color to black.

entries.name: BLUE
entries.desc: Set the terminal's foreground ANSI color to blue.

entries.name: BOLD
entries.desc: The start of an ANSI bold sequence.

entries.name: CLEAR
entries.desc: Embed in a String to clear all previous ANSI sequences.

entries.name: CYAN
entries.desc: Set the terminal's foreground ANSI color to cyan.

entries.name: GREEN
entries.desc: Set the terminal's foreground ANSI color to green.

entries.name: MAGENTA
entries.desc: Set the terminal's foreground ANSI color to magenta.

entries.name: ON_BLACK
entries.desc: Set the terminal's background ANSI color to black.

entries.name: ON_BLUE
entries.desc: Set the terminal's background ANSI color to blue.

entries.name: ON_CYAN
entries.desc: Set the terminal's background ANSI color to cyan.

entries.name: ON_GREEN
entries.desc: Set the terminal's background ANSI color to green.

entries.name: ON_MAGENTA
entries.desc: Set the terminal's background ANSI color to magenta.

entries.name: ON_RED
entries.desc: Set the terminal's background ANSI color to red.

entries.name: ON_WHITE
entries.desc: Set the terminal's background ANSI color to white.

entries.name: ON_YELLOW
entries.desc: Set the terminal's background ANSI color to yellow.

entries.name: RED
entries.desc: Set the terminal's foreground ANSI color to red.

entries.name: WHITE
entries.desc: Set the terminal's foreground ANSI color to white.

entries.name: YELLOW
entries.desc: Set the terminal's foreground ANSI color to yellow.

entries.name: set_color(string, *colors)
entries.desc: Set color by using a string or one of the defined constants. If a third option is set to true, it also adds bold to the string. This is based on Highline implementation and it automatically appends CLEAR to the end of the returned String.
